title: Interpret slope for Australian pine age and height

content.prompt: Which of the following is the best interpretation of the slope of the regression line?

choices.label: The height increases, on average, by 1 meter each 0.48 year.
The height increases, on average, by 0.48 meter each year.
The height increases, on average, by 0.29 meter each year.
The height increases, on average, by 0.29 meter each 0.48 year.
The difference between the actual height and the predicted height is, on average, 0.48 meter for each year.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
